intro: Heliotropium leiocarpum f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
